title: Lightweight GitHub Stats
desc: Uses Python and Github Actions to display stats for your GitHub profile.
desc2: It's made to avoid needing to host a server for GitHub stats.

title: Twitter Clone
desc: A functioning Twitter clone with a Vue.js frontend.
desc2: The project uses Django as a REST API server.

title: Simple Stat Rings
desc: Displays the all of users stats using rings.
desc2: My most popular watch face with over 300+ reviews.

title: SamaritanGPT
desc: A Person of Interest Samaritan inspired ChatGPT website.
desc2: Uses a given API key to access the ChatGPT API.

title: Stacker
desc: A Vue.js version of the popular arcade machine.
desc2: Now with added customization with themes and sizes.

title: Does The Shark Die
desc: A site for checking if a shark dies in a movie.
desc2: Jaws would have devastated me as a kid so being able to check would have been helpful.

title: Clockface.json
desc: A watch face which displays details like a JSON file in vscode.
desc2: It went viral on reddit and has 134 stars on GitHub.

title: Quantum Poem
desc: A simple tribute to Outer Wilds in React.
desc2: The poem changes when you refresh or click the page.

title: TimePresentation
desc: A watch face designed to look like PowerPoint.

title: Sonar Secure Messaging
desc: A secure android app using a custom messaging protocol based on onion routing.
desc2: My final year project and won an award for best proof of concept.

title: Steamed Hams Watch
desc: A watch OS that tells time using the Steamed Hams clip.
desc2: It runs on the open source watch, Watchy.

title: Prescriptive Analytics
desc: The code I used when teaching Prescriptive Analytics.
desc2: Contains code for both OPL and Lingo.
